entry.title: Fiber is coming!
entry.content:
I’ve waited long for it, but “Fiber is coming„!

Only one street away, and on Friday the will start putting fiber in our street! Can’t to finaly have a proper connection and leave an era of cable behind me.

When I first got cable internet (1999), it was a bliss! Internet for a fixed price a month! It has been a lot of years, and still cable isn’t offering symetric connections.

entry.title: New theme
entry.content:
Some time ago, I started using Octopress to generate my website. Now I finally to the time the install a theme, so it looks less generic.

One thing I pertically like about Octopress, is the use of Markdown to write posts and pages. It really beats HTML, as only the content is part of your post instead of being little collections of HTML code.

Another thing: as it only generates flat HTML files, this save you time on installing security updates and it can be set-up to host on GitHub.

entry.title: Finally FttH
entry.content:
Finally FttH!

Just a week or so, and then they’ll finaly put fiber in our streets. I can’t wait to finaly have a proper internet connection (with symetric speeds).

My current connection runs over the cable network provided by Ziggo, which is better then any ADSL connection I can get here, but it’s still not very good. The problem is probably due to the cable sharing with the neighbours, or water in the cable.

entry.title: New provider
entry.content:
After being a customer of XS4all for several years, the difference in speed was getting larger and larger. And they didn't add anything to make the loss of speed nor the extra costs worth while. So we switched back to Ziggo. It is realy nice to have a reasonable speed!

Also the digital TV XS4all provided, still is a hassle as all TV's still realy on cable and need a STB to work.

entry.title: Nice subscription! 500 GiB for only € 10!
15" MacBook Pro, 2.4 GHz i5, 4Gb, 320 Gb, Applecare till January 7, 2014
entry.content:
As I’m to switch to a MacBook Air and a Mac Mini, I’m putting my relatively new MacBook Pro for sale, inclusive AppleCare until January 7, 2014!

Including all original software and accessoires (e.g. Mac OS X 10.6, iLife ‘11, power adapter and original box).

entry.title: WWDC 2011 is in my virtual pocket!
For sale: Macbook Pro 15.4" 2.53 GHz, 4/320GB-MB471LL/A
entry.content:
As I try to update my Mac every two years, it’s time to sell my Mac again.

  • 15.4” Macbook Pro;
  • Intel Core 2 Duo 2.53 GHz cpu (“Penryn” T9400) with 6MB cache;
  • 4GB memory;
  • GeForce 9600M GT graphics card with 512MB for performance;
  • GeForce  9400M onboard graphics card to safe battery;
  • 320 GB hard disk;
  • Glossy 1440x900 screen;
  • and AppleCare till january 27 2012.

To find more information about the model, you can use this number: MB471LL/A.

If you need any information, please contact me.

entry.title: Venician sunset. Photo taken from the Molino Stucky hotel in Venice during a #sogeti work trip.
iPads!
iPhone, iPad, etc.
entry.content:
Although I try to regularly update this weblog, I can’t find time to do this.

The last few weeks I visited an other company which creates uniform mobile application. Looking back at the previous company we visited, this company is miles ahead of them. The applications run smoothly and look like they have been created specially for the platform it runs in. Also the development tools are more mature, as they use proven technologies like the IDE Eclipse.

We also worked on some proposals for client in several sectors and created a POC.

It looks like the internal mobile project will be launched anytime soon! I can’t wait to get my hands on the new hardware we ordered. I just have to be patient…

entry.title: POC for financial client
entry.content: For this morning, we had an appointment with a financial client to create a POC for the iPhone, iPad and BlackBerry devices. The iPhone and iPad applications where quickly deployed, but the BlackBerry gave us some trouble. Although this was solved hours before the deadline. For now, we wait.

entry.title: Sales app
entry.content:
Today we presented an internal application for our sales division. This application is intended to support our sales division on the road and is intended to run on the iPhone. We created the application within two weeks. During these two weeks, a noticed again that it is hard to get access to all the information you need and in the way you need it.

Lets create more apps! Anyone any suggestions?

entry.title: Multiplatform mobile solutions
entry.content: Today we went to a company which has a product to quickly deploy mobile application over five platforms. It look very promising, although there are some drawbacks. Because the application is party deployed as a web application, the applications don’t respond as quickly as you’d like. But on the other side, you can create application very quickly.

entry.title: Hannah
entry.content:
On monday January 4 on 9.40, our daughter Hannah was born. She came into this world by an SC. Mother and doughter have to remain in the hospital, so my wife can recover from the SC.

Yesterday I went to the city hall to register her birth. Her full name is Hannah Judith Hester Geartsje.
